thread.title: Rakesh Roshan confirms Kaabil to be the first Indian film to release in Pakistan after the ban was lifted
thread.title_full: Rakesh Roshan confirms Kaabil to be the first Indian film to release in Pakistan after the ban was lifted

author: moumita bhattacharjee
title: Rakesh Roshan confirms Kaabil to be the first Indian film to release in Pakistan after the ban was lifted
text:
Rakesh Roshan Rakesh Roshan confirms Kaabil… Rakesh Roshan confirms Kaabil to be the first Indian film to release in Pakistan after the ban was lifted Now Hrithik Roshan's fans in Pakistan will also come to know why Kaabil is getting bigger and better with every passing day. By moumita bhattacharjee | Published: February 1, 2017 1:15 pm Hrithik Roshan’s surprise visit to Chandan Cinema for his fans – check out Kaabil star’s pics 
Kaabil has proved that it’s Kaabil enough to take on anyone, however big the opponent is. Hrithik Roshan not only does it in the film but in the real life too by standing tall in front of Shah Rukh Khan’s Raees. Now his fans in Pakistan will also come to know why Kaabil is getting bigger and better with every passing day. Yes, Rakesh Roshan EXCLUSIVELY confirmed to us that Kaabil is releasing in Pakistan. 
Rakesh Roshan said, “Yes Kaabil is releasing in Pakistan tomorrow or day after tomorrow. I have just got a call from my distributor Satish Anand that the breakthrough has been done by Kaabil. I felt very nice and he said hope this relation continues between the two countries.” So Kaabil will become the first film to release in Pakistan after the ban on Indian films were lifted there. He confirms the same saying, “Yes it’s the first film to release. Only Kaabil.” 
It definitely is a big deal for the Hrithik film. Pakistan Government had lifted the ban and there were reports that Kaabil, Raees and Dangal will release after they are certified by the Censor board. Guess Kaabil managed to get their first. Also Read: Hrithik Roshan wants to save his Kaabil and Shah Rukh Khan’s Raees from piracy 
Despite getting just 40 percent of the overall screens in India, Hrithik Roshan and Rakesh Roshan’s Kaabil is still managing to maintain quite a steady momentum at the box office. Having passed the first Monday test, the revenge drama further went on to collect Rs 6.10 crore yesterday, now taking its 7 day total to Rs 79.60 crore. Trade experts suggest Kaabil is likely to finish this first week with Rs 90 crore plus or you never know, the film might also touch the Rs 100 crore within this coming weekend coz what’s working for Kaabil right now is the critical acclaim and the word of mouth publicity. 
Stay tuned to this space for more update on Kaabil and Raees. Published: February 1, 2017 1:15 pm Topics:
